abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings show satisfactory project
            outcomes, likely sustainability, but only modest
            institutional development impacts. Among the several lessons
            learned, it is suggested the Government provide strong
            incentives for external revenue generating activities, so
            that research institutions can move from being wholly
            government-funded, to developing its self-financing
            capacity. Institutions should be allowed to retain, and
            accumulate their earnings, as well as the ability to use
            such earnings with greater flexibility, and freedom. The
            project experience with institutions learning from each
            other, proved useful, and with positive results; it would
            thus be beneficial for future project design, to explore the
            possibility of twining among institutions within the
            country, rather than seeking foreign inputs. It is
            reinforced, that procurement training at the early stages
            should be provided, considering as well additional capacity
            building for implementing agencies, particularly when Bank
            procurement guidelines are seemingly new to borrowers, a
            fact that could avoid unnecessary delays during
            implementation. In addition, it is important to provide easy
            access to capital financing, and technology for small and
            medium scale industries (SMIs), to achieve business growth,
            and fully utilize the technology, management, and marketing
            skills acquired under the project. To this end the project
            should have been integrated in a broader strategy of
            assistance to SMIs.
